name: Cauliflower Salad
description: This cauliflower salad with roasted chickpeas, tomatoes, and a light curry yogurt dressing makes such a great lunch! It's super easy to make, vegan, so delicious, and incredibly healthy.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup unsweetened plant-based yogurt  ((coconut or soy yogurt))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400 °F. Cut the cauliflower into medium-sized florets. Drain and rinse the canned chickpeas.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat your oven to 400 °F. Cut the cauliflower into medium-sized florets. Drain and rinse the canned chickpeas.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the cauliflower and the chickpeas on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the cauliflower and the chickpeas on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the olive oil and 1 teaspoon paprika powder and 1 teaspoon curry powder. Stir until all of the cauliflower florets and the chickpeas are coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the olive oil and 1 teaspoon paprika powder and 1 teaspoon curry powder. Stir until all of the cauliflower florets and the chickpeas are coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 20 minutes at 400 °F. Stir and bake for another 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 20 minutes at 400 °F. Stir and bake for another 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the dressing. Place the plant-based yogurt and the curry powder (2 teaspoons) in a small bowl. Add salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the dressing. Place the plant-based yogurt and the curry powder (2 teaspoons) in a small bowl. Add salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the tomatoes and cut the green onions into rings.
recipeInstructions.name: Dice the tomatoes and cut the green onions into rings.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the roasted cauliflower and chickpeas to a large bowl and add the tomatoes and the green onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the roasted cauliflower and chickpeas to a large bowl and add the tomatoes and the green onions.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully stir with a wooden spoon. Add a bit of freshly chopped parsley and red pepper flakes on top if you want. Serve the salad immediately or store in the fridge for later.
